- So, hey, I'm Kevin O'waki.

and we're gonna talk about the infinite game
of civil resistance in this workshop.
This workshop will be about 25 minutes

and then we're gonna actually get into some code

from there.

is an important problem to address.

and then we're gonna talk about
a civil resistance money-lego.
So, just very briefly, civil resistance is just basically,
how do you prevent sock puppet accounts

How do you create more one-human, one-vote-based systems
in the web three?
In this room, we are all physical humans,

How many people have used Gitcoin grants?

has supported so much public goods funding
in the Ethereum ecosystem.

that is how Gitcoin grants works,
and the reason why it's so magical.
We're gonna do a quick quadratic funding calculation,
but before I do that, I just wanna say
that Vitalik, Booter, and Glen Weil, and Zoe Hitzig
are the ones that actually came up with quadratic funding.
And I view it as this perfect alien crystal intelligence
that I just inherited, and we're the ones
who are kind of bringing it to the world,
of course, along with CLR Fund
and some other great projects that are doing QF.
So anyway, the way QF works is that every quarter on Gitcoin,
there's $3 million worth of matching,
and we distribute it contemporaneously,
which is just a fancy word for at the same time,
as a crowdfunding campaign.
And with quadratic funding,
if more people contribute to your grant,
then you will get more funding from the matching pool.
So in this example, both grants get $10,
but grant get one gets way more of the matching pool
because it has more identities associated with it.
And what's really cool is this gets you off your bum
in order to contribute to public goods,
because now a dollar worth of impact
can have a $100 donation can be worth $100 worth of impact,
or a $10 donation can be worth $1,000 worth of impact.

where a $1 donation to Coin Center,
which is a grant that,
which is a project that does lobbying in DC,
a $1 donation to Coin Center
would give $1,000 worth of impact.

we hit the meme number, $69 million worth of funding
of for public goods on Gitcoin.
If you look at it at a systemic level,
the contribution graph at Gitcoin Grants
is what I'm most proud of.

and every node is a user or a grant.

you're kind of coming up with a mesh network

in your Get Coin Passport.

is only valid when it's justified and consented to
by the people that it governs.
So basically what you don't want to have
is basically like a company that owns all
